Row.Text: One night while camping out, Gassire couldn't sleep. So he decided plucked the strings, the lute began to play a beautiful battle song. At the same moment his father passed away. The lute began to play again and this time all of Gassire's anger dissipated and he wept with both grief and joy. The song that he sang and the music that he played were the most beautiful things ever. The guilt was for his dead sons and father the only happiness he felt at the moment was that he would be remembered for his battle song and his heroic deeds.
Wagadu rose and fell four times: once through vanity. Once through dishonesty. Once through greed. Once through discord.
